thread.title: Southwest Spain on red alert for flooding - Telegraph - Telegraph
thread.title_full: Southwest Spain on red alert for flooding - Telegraph - Telegraph

author: @Telegrafisti
title: Southwest Spain on red alert for flooding - Telegraph - Telegraph
text: A red weather alert has been issued for the Spanish province of Huelva. Aemet, the Spanish weather agency, reported torrential rains in cities such as Cartaya. It is known that the warning remains active, writes [sky news](https://news.sky.com/story/spain-floods-latest-people-trapped-like-rats-as-deadly-floods-leave-valencia-towns-under-water-13244547?postid=8543020#liveblog-body), the Telegraph reports. ⚠️WATCH GUARD | Province of Huelva. ⛈️Se están registrando torrential rains in localities like Cartaya, with 117 l/m² in less than three hours. 70 de ellos en solo una hora. El aviso sigue activo, por ahora, hasta las 9:00 La [#dana]va a seguir provocando hoy tiempo adverso.[pic.twitter.com/9fbyOAdTII]— AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) [November 1, 2024] Otherwise, during a speech in Valencia, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced that this area will also be declared a disaster area and that the official crisis level has been raised to two. Sanchez said people affected by the disaster should stay indoors, with more torrential rains forecast. "The most important thing is that I know that the Spanish are aware that this phenomenon is not over," said Sanchez. "The Spanish weather agency has still raised alerts in Valencia and around Spain. So I urge everyone to listen to those recommendations and heed the advice of law enforcement and defense authorities," he added. /Telegraph/ Promo [Advertise here](https://marketing.telegrafi.com) [ From Fafa Resort ](https://telegrafi.com/en/from-stress-and-everyday-life-to-relaxation-and-quiet-weekend-in-grand-blue-fafa/) From stress and everyday life to relaxation and tranquility - the weekend at Grand Blue Fafa!
